leads.lead_text: Branchlets densely subtomentose or subvillous; leaf lower surface subsericeous with predominantly mutually aligned, appressed hairs with scattered ascending hairs, or occasionally subtomentose with a lower layer of predominantly mutually aligned, appressed hairs with an overlayer of scattered ascending and suberect hairs
Branchlets densely subvillous; leaf lower surface villous, the hairs erect or suberect

Leaves ovate to elliptic or occasionally obovate (occasionally narrowly so), (22–)30–85 mm long, 15–33 mm wide; leaf margins rolled downwards to shortly recurved; conflorescences usually simple or once-branched; floral rachis 22–26(–42) mm long
Leaves elliptic to occasionally ovate, (9–)20–35(–50) mm long, 8–16(–25) mm wide; leaf margins distinctly revolute; conflorescences usually simple; floral rachis (5–)12–20(–25) mm long
